stimulusHtml: Although Improvisation 28 (second version) is largely an abstract image with musical references, Vassily Kandinsky also incorporated recognizable imagery to communicate meaning, such as
choicesHtml: planets and stars, as an allusion to cosmic forces
crowds of people, to suggest the chaotic quality of modern life
a forest of trees and shrubs, to suggest the power of nature
a horseman and a city, as an allusion to the Apocalypse
